author: Special Correspondent
text:
Claims they are favouring the ruling party

Alleging that five IAS officials and several senior police officers across the State, including the Chennai Police Commissioner, were favouring the ruling party, the DMK submitted memorandums to the Chief Electoral Officer (CEO) on Tuesday seeking to transfer them.

The memorandums submitted by the DMK’s Legal Wing named five IAS officials, including four District Collectors and 44 police officers, including Police Commissioners of four cities and alleged that they were handpicked by members of the ruling party “to aid in the malpractices” during the election, as it had happened in 2014 Parliamentary elections.

“DMK requests your good offices to kindly shift them out of election work and immediately place them out of district to ensure the conduct of peaceful, fair and neutral election atmosphere,” the memorandums by DMK’s Organisation Secretary R.S. Bharathi to the CEO stated.

DMK’s Legal Wing Joint Secretary I. Paranthamen, Deputy Secretary K.S. Ravichandran, advocates Suriya Vetrikondan and R. Neelakandan submitted the memorandums to the CEO.

The memorandums were addressed to the Chief Election Commissioner, two Election Commissioners and the CEO.
title: DMK seeks transfer of four Collectors
